green gleam of her eyes was some what dulled, and her mouth, so purple of yore, had now only a pale, tender rose-tint almost like that of her cheeks.</blockquote>
green gleam of her eyes was some what dulled, and her mouth, so purple of yore, had now only a pale, tender rose-tint almost like that of her cheeks.</blockquote>

One could argue that the [[Legend of Osiris and Isis]] involved a necrophilic act; [[Isis]] is said to have fathered [[Horus]] with the dead [[Osiris]]'s dismembered penis, albeit miraculously. According to ''Christian Origins in Egyptian Mythology'', "an ancient Egyptian relief depicts this conception by showing his mother Isis in a falcon form, hovering over an erect phallus of a dead and prone Osiris in the Underworld."<ref>http://www.godisamyth.com/regs/ez/egypt.htm</ref>
+
One could argue that the [[Legend of Osiris and Isis]] involved a necrophilic act; [[Isis]] is said to have fathered [[Horus]] with the dead [[Osiris]]'s dismembered penis, albeit miraculously. According to ''Christian Origins in Egyptian Mythology'', "an ancient Egyptian relief depicts this conception by showing his mother Isis in a falcon form, hovering over an erect phallus of a dead and prone Osiris in the Underworld."<ref>[http://www.godisamyth.com/regs/ez/egypt.htm Christian Origins in Egyptian Mythology<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
In [[Toni Morrison]]'s [[novel]] ''[[Song of Solomon (novel)|Song of Solomon]]'', Macon Dead is explaining to his son Milkman that he is disturbed by the relationship that his wife Ruth had with her father, Dr. Foster. Shortly after Dr. Foster's death, Macon caught Ruth lying naked in bed with her father's corpse, while sucking on his fingers.
In [[Toni Morrison]]'s [[novel]] ''[[Song of Solomon (novel)|Song of Solomon]]'', Macon Dead is explaining to his son Milkman that he is disturbed by the relationship that his wife Ruth had with her father, Dr. Foster. Shortly after Dr. Foster's death, Macon caught Ruth lying naked in bed with her father's corpse, while sucking on his fingers.
